@ padme99 I usually burn these kind of stuff with imgburn with slow speed (4X, or 2X). Same with OS images

PATH TO SMALL LINUX BASED ISO

Paragon.Hard.Disk.Manager.12.Professional.[...].isoSOURCESBOOT.WIMPrograms

Paragon SoftwareISObootcd.iso

Grub4DOS: menu.lst:
title Paragon Festplatten-Manager 12 Pro ISO (10.0.19.15177)
map --mem /BootIMGs/bootcd.iso (hd32)
map --hook
chainloader (hd32)
boot

PATH TO SMALL LINUX-BASED ISO

Paragon.Hard.Disk.Manager.12.Professional.[...].iso/SOURCES/BOOT.WIM/Programs/Paragon Software/ISO/bootcd.iso

Grub4DOS: menu.lst:
title Paragon Festplatten-Manager 12 Pro ISO (10.0.19.15177)
map --mem /BootIMGs/bootcd.iso (hd32)
map --hook
chainloader (hd32)
boot

Would someone please advise me.  I booted to an external dvd boot disc and created a full system backup on DVD's.  Now when I boot to the boot disc I am unable to figure out the procedure for restoring the system.

I now know how to restore.  You boot to the 1st disc in the Backup set and follow the menu.  I had a 37% fragmented hard drive which Disktrix and Windows were unable/unwilling to defrag.  Running Paragon Defrag (from the 1st Backup Disc and booted directly there) the Hard Drive is now at 1%, verified by Disktrix.  Wow!!!  Thank you Nikita.
Works flawless.. As always.
